glsa.title: Apache 2.0: Denial of Service by memory consumption
glsa.synopsis: A flaw in Apache 2.0 could allow a remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service.

background.p: The Apache HTTP Server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.

description.p: Chintan Trivedi discovered a vulnerability in Apache httpd 2.0 that is caused by improper enforcing of the field length limit in the header-parsing code.

impact.p: By sending a large amount of specially-crafted HTTP GET requests a remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service of the targeted system.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Apache 2.0 users should upgrade to the latest version:
